final_answer.precision_note: Reported to 3 significant figures matching the precision of input measurements.

method: First convert time to seconds: 30.0 min = 30.0 × 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge using Q = I × t: Q = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 / 96500 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- → Cu, 2 moles of electrons produce 1 mole of copper. So moles of Cu = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Calculate mass of copper: mass = n × Ar = 0.01399 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
checks: Stoichiometry correct: 2 electrons per Cu2+ ion reduced
Final mass is reasonable for 30 minutes of electrolysis at 1.5 A
